_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:32:11 using v2.7
title: Does feeling supported to manage their long-term condition(s) differ by age?
analysis_commentary:
Patients feeling that they are supported to manage their long-term condition(s) is a measure in the NHS Outcomes Framework (2013/2014) and the GP patient survey data has been analysed and published to investigate if different cohorts of patients feel supported to manage their long-term condition(s) as part of this programme.

There was no difference in both 2012/2013 and 2013/2014 in how the sexes responded (data not shown). However, there is variation between different age groups in how patients feel about being supported. Fewer patients in the younger age groups feel supported to manage their long-term condition(s) in both years. This is lowest in the 18 to 24 and the 25 to 34 age groups, where only 56.2% and 56.3% felt supported in 2013/14 respectively. The 65 to 74 year old age group felt the most supported to manage their long-term condition(s) (76.5% in 2013/14).
